info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:43PM EDT until July 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ESSEX...WESTERN ORANGE...SOUTHERN ADDISON...NORTHERN RUTLAND AND NORTHWESTERN WINDSOR COUNTIES... At 443 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over East Shoreham, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Middlebury, Castleton, Sudbury, Killington, Salisbury, Rutland City, Orwell, Rochester, Benson, Chittenden, West Rutland, Whiting, Granville, Goshen, West Castleton, Hancock, Hubbardton, Shoreham and Ripton. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
